summary:
Experienced Independent multi-lingual financial services and international business professional with a proven track record in a broad spectrum of the Financial Services industry as well as hands-on experience in international business. Strong consulting professional skilled in Business Strategy, Business Planning, Business Development, Operations Management, International Cash Management, Working Capital Finance, Factoring, Trade Finance and International Payments in 10 countries and 3 continents.
40 years of experience in Europe, Latin America, Middle East and Africa - commercial banking, Micro and SME financing projects, financial and business consultancy. Native Dutch speaker, fluent in English, German, Spanish and Portuguese, proficient in French.

[{'company': {'id': 18655382, 'name': 'None', 'logo': None, 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/roadvista-ltd/', 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Amsterdam Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'None', 'description': 'Strategic and operational (general) business consultancy, special focus on strategic positioning of new investments in financial services, business (joint) ventures, green field operations, fintec ventures. 
Due diligence , evaluation of investment & business plans, strategic partner search, representation & interim management. 
Business savvy groomed in 40 years in 15 countries on 4 continents of which 25 years in Latin America.
Extensive business and living experience in a.o. Argentina, Uruguay, Chile, Paraguay, Peru, Ecuador, Brazil, Spain, Kenya and Bahrein.
Strong international network with the right contacts in business and government.
Been around long enough to know the ropes: rule #1 - when planning a (new) business venture in a foreign country be sure to identify all the "show stoppers" and evaluate the risk associated with each of them; rule #2 you never know everything, even if you think you do, so engage local knowledge and expertise ; rule #3 - the unexpected WILL happen even if you do not know what it is, so you have to allow for this in planning budget and timeframe; rule #4 know when to quit, if there are strong signs that the odds are stacked against you the best option generally is to walk away; rule #5 never accept things at face value - when it looks too good to be true it DEFINITELY is not true. Use common sense and ask advice from trusted and knowledgeable sources.', 'title': 'Independent Business Consultant / Director / Board Member ', 'employment_type': 'Self-employed'}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'TRFI PERU SOCIEDAD DE PROPOSITO ESPECIAL SAC', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Lima, Lima, Peru', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'company': 'TRFI PERU SOCIEDAD DE PROPOSITO ESPECIAL SAC', 'description': "Managed all operations related to the trustee functions of the company. Monitored performance of factoring parties through the TREFI platform, compliance of factoring parties with financier covenants and daily settlement of factoring cash flows. Handled reporting requirements to supervising authorities and contacts with commercial parties and financiers.
TRFI Peru is a special purpose company that is active in the field of factoring. TRFI Peru buys SME invoice portfolios from medium/large companies with the purpose to improve working capital (more credit,better credit terms) of the SME's and improve the portfolio debtor's risk of the medium/large companies. Finance is provided to TRFI Peru by external investors and (semi) government institutions (e.g. COFIDE). TRFI Peru uses the TREFI ™ platform to register and process the purchased invoices, to settle the resulting financial transactions and to manage associated risks.", 'title': 'General Manager', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Stichting Trade Receivable Standards Board', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Amsterdam Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'company': 'Stichting Trade Receivable Standards Board', 'description': 'The TRSB is non-profit Organization that maintains a set of standards for the management and financing of receivables in order to promote the certainty and flexibility of trade, while protecting the privacy of all parties involved.

TRSB connects MSME enterprises to financiers by bridging the information gap between them.

The TRSB promotes superior liquidity for large companies, their buyers, and suppliers; and it helps MSME entrepreneurs develop self-sustaining businesses, create jobs, build productive capacity, and foster inclusion as it relieves the constraint on MSME growth due to the lack of traditional bank financing in for their sector.

By doing so, the TRSB helps to create and distribute wealth more equitably in society as people lift themselves up from poverty, achieve financial independance, and engage in productive enterprise without being held down by the power of capital.

In order to achieve our goal, the Board champions a strong foundation of integrity, trust and ethical conduct, and requests reciprocal commitments from all its service providers and standard users. TRSB’s policies follow these principals.

By creating the enabling conditions for small businesses to grow beyond the abilities of conventional sources of finance, TRSB potentially sets in motion a progression for every TRSB user.', 'title': 'Managing Director', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Capital Tool Company BV', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Amsterdam Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'company': 'Capital Tool Company BV', 'description': 'Managed operations in The Netherlands and Peru. Performed business development activities in/related to The Netherlands, Peru, Kenya and Kazakhstan.
Capital Tool Company is the leading provider of receivable risk-based valuation tools and develops cutting edge financial solution technology to value credit and liquidity risks of receivables. CTC has developed the platform TREFI (Trade Receivable Finance Infrastructure) and has developed and calibrates the TREFI risk models.
The TREFI solution may impact SME at all levels in various industries and in various locations. By improving the access to working capital finance of the SMEs their ability to grow is improved. In this growth they will improve the lives of their employees, their clients and the people in their environment. We highlight the credit reports that the solution creates for the SMEs involved. These credit reports are much more predictive of future default because the information used includes those gathered by multiple suppliers on a daily basis. Credit bureaus typically only gather events where the clients is in default (>90 days overdue). The solutions ability to monitor the flow of financing to SMEs provides transparency to policy makers implementing the scheme. The product (in particular from a risk adjusted basis) is attractive for the SMEs, suppliers, and financiers, including governments. As a result all parties will collaborate in its implementation and growth. read more www.trefi.com', 'title': 'Director Global Operations', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Gamelion BV', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2003}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Weert - The Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2003}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'company': 'Gamelion BV', 'description': 'Independent consultant providing advice and hands-on expertise to entrepreneurs on choosing business models and building cases for business start-up in Argentina, Chile, Uruguay, Paraguay and  Peru.18 years experience in Latin America.
